string_table:
#include "text\eng\sak_strings_treasure.xml"
Well, what happens now? You going to close the Arena? Search for love and happiness in exotic lands, and get rid of some of that excess radiation?
This your first time here? That was just one tournament. One of many...
Good. That's what I was hoping. What comes next, then?
Here's the deal. This time you became the Arena champion, but that's a very tenuous title, and there's no guarantee we won't be scraping you off the floor next time. Tournaments are arranged pretty regularly, once or twice a day. Matches are usually from 22:00 to 06:00, but we sometimes start earlier or finish later. Some days we're closed. It depends on how many bums are on the seats, and how many contestants and mutants we've got in reserve.\nI'll notify you by SMS when they start, so keep an eye on your PDA. While you're still the champion, you'll have full access to all announced fights. You also get to decide in which order you'll fight, and what weapons you use.\nThere are strict rules about explosives and other shit, though. Gauss rifles, miniguns, grenade launchers, RPG-7's and so on are usually banned, because the punters don't like it.\nThat's pretty much it. The Arena still needs to be hosed down, so why don't you go and have a drink in the Bar? Just don't miss the next fight - okay, champ?
No problem...
Welcome back, champ!
Hi. What's going on today?
Wow, you got a death wish? We don't have enough contestants yet. Come back later
Good deal
Congratulations. Good call...
So, it wasn't your day. Better luck next time...
Here's your well-earned cash
Great fight! You've earned this...
Your victory will not be counted
You will be fined for violating the rules
Hey there, champ! Good to have you back at the Arena! I've not yet found a worthy enough opponent to grab your title, but hear me out. Why don't we put on a special show today? Just you against two or three mutants? I paid for some fresh ones especially for the contest, but there's good money to be had all round...
Marked One, listen. We have a problem. Factions that usually kick the shit out of each other have decided to unite against a common enemy
Oh, that's good. How is it a problem?
The problem, my friend, is that the enemy is you. Remember all those guys you've sent to the other side? Well, these guys are refusing to fight you alone, but they want to take you on together...
Hey there, champ! We're so full with mutants lately, we're almost out of room in the cages and they're eating each other! Trouble is that nobody wants to fight them. Do you want to free up some space for us? You'll be paid well, of course...
I'll think about it
Come on! The work's good. You entertain the spectators, and earn yourself some readies at the same time...
Great, Marked One. The Arena's open again, so pick a match, quickly. Our schedule's pretty full today
Greetings, Stalker
Hello, Marked One!
I have a request, please
What do you need?
Would you put me back on your notification list?
As you wish...
Would you stop sending me those messages?
No problem. I'll delete you from the list
Can you switch on a few more of those lights in the Arena? It's too dark to see clearly...
I'll see what I can do
Would you put the lights back to how they were? I'm losing the advantage of surprise...
Turn them on. Turn them off again. I wish you'd make up your mind. The bloody wiring here's a rat's nest...
DELETE MOD
Are you sure?
Yes
No
Sorry. Forget it
What fights are on today?
Nothing at the moment. We're closed. Come back later
That's all for today. Nobody else wants to fight you...
Choose
Maybe some other time
Thanks, but I changed my mind
If you're really sure of yourself, may I suggest a timed match? These fights don't last long, but they do require an understanding of your opponents. There's a chance of a bonus or even doubling your winnings if you clear the Arena in the shortest time.\nThere's just one cast iron rule - you MUST NOT kill an opponent after the timer runs out. If you do, you'll be fined the same amount as your winnings would have been.\nI'm sure you'll agree that it's better to come out alive, without a prize, than having to pay out what you were supposed to win after all that work. And I need as many warm bodies as possible for the other matches, so you'll also be helping me by sticking to that rule.\nWhat do you say? Shall I start the clock?
5 seconds
10 seconds
15 seconds
20 seconds
30 seconds
40 seconds
50 seconds
60 seconds
No, thanks
Thanks, but I changed my mind
On whom are you placing your bets?
against
Nobody. I changed my mind
How much do you want to bet?
Roubles
Maybe another time. I'm broke
Thanks, but I don't care for the odds
All bets have been registered. No more bets
Let's roll
Totaliser
Do you want to make some cash without risking your own blood? Then bet on others winning instead. You can place bets in two ways - battles against the mutants, or faction tournaments. Just tell me who you're betting on to win, place your stake, and watch the fight.\nIf you win, you get your stake back plus your winnings. If you lose, then at least you gained experience, with the knowledge that your errors of judgement didn't get you killed in there.\nWhat'll it be?
Thanks, but I changed my mind
On the Military
The Military
the Military
On the Mercenaries
Mercenaries
Mercenaries
On Freedom
Freedomers
Freedomers
On Duty
Duty
Duty
On the Loners
Loners
Loners
On the Bandits
Bandits
Bandits
On the dog pack
Dogs
dogs
On the boars
Boars
boars
On the Snorks
Snorks
snorks
On the Bloodsucker
A Bloodsucker
Bloodsucker
On the zombies
Zombies
zombies
On the chimera
A chimera
a chimera
On the burer
A burer
a burer
On the pseudogiant
A pseudogiant
a pseudogiant
Mutants
Finally, Duty has started delivering live mutants to the Arena again, including a few rare ones. What do you want to go up against?
A battle against the Military
The first thing that comes to everyone's mind is "What the freaking hell are these guys doing in the Bar?" Well, thanks to their numerous connections, Duty can organise and allow this. There are few doubts as to the professionalism of these soldiers, who had years of experience behind them even before the Zone appeared. Some of these guys have done tours in Afghanistan, Georgia, and Chechnya. Then they've spent several more years policing and raiding the Zone, so they're still sharp. They also have the best weapons and body armor the Russian government can produce. But they don't get paid well, which is why they come here...
A match against the Mercs
The Mercenaries are a well-organized paramilitary group made up of freelance contractors. They're financed well, and carry imported guns. Rumor is that they work for foreign interests and governments, in addition to Russian, Ukrainian, and maybe even Georgian clients. I'd call them a side-effect of the Ukrainian government trying hard to join NATO. These guys are ruthless, and the locals try to keep as far away from them as possible - but to the Military, they're like a bone stuck in their throat. They give the Mercs the highest priority if they spot them, which kind of makes me respect the soldiers, because the Mercs' have some serious firepower, and they enjoy killing...
A fight against Freedom
Freedomers are the sworn arch-enemies of Duty. They have a lot of former Dutyers among their ranks, those who rejected the 'We are the last hope of humanity' ideology. That's one of the reasons relations between their factions are still tense, to put it mildly. Even though Duty considers Freedom to be nothing more than a gaggle of stoned anarchists, Freedom still put up a hard fight. Freedom is definitely better organized than that, and their guns and armor aren't too bad either. Duty had many of their best fighters cross over, so they're right to be wary of an enemy that knows their tactics. At the moment, there's a cease-fire between the two factions, but it's never far from erupting again...
A fight against Duty
The Duty faction is our self-declared police force. They clear out mutants from inhabited areas, then they sell them to me on the side. But it's largely thanks to them that we actually have men fighting to the death in our little Arena. Duty members participate in Arena matches to hone their skills, and steel themselves for future raids into unknown parts of the Zone. They have a good quartermaster, so they're armed with the same gear as Spetsnaz troops, and some of the best Warsaw Pact weapons you'll ever see here
A fight against the Loners...
The usual Loners. You know, the ones that stay away from, or haven't yet joined a faction. It's a good way to make enemies, or thin out your competition for artefacts, but these have rubbed someone up the wrong way. You might recognize some familiar faces among them, even the guy you shared a bottle with a few weeks back. They're armed with a decent selection of weapons they've picked up - Warsaw Pact guns, imported rifles, you name it, but I've yet to see anything I'd sell a kidney for...
A fight against Bandits...
The usual bunch of Death Row scumbags captured in the Dark Valley. But don't imagine they'll be toting their rusty double-barrels, or the Makarovs they looted from the cops they killed back in '75. They've got decent arena weapons, so watch out...
A battle against the 'Zoner Team'...
Every faction is represented in this team, making the number of opponents higher than usual, with each of them dead-set on repaying you for killing their comrades...
I understand...
You know your chances of coming out of this alive are very slim indeed? That's why the odds against you are so high. Are you sure you want to do this?
I've been through worse. Announce the match
A battle against mutants...
Stalkers from different factions try to kill two mutants, or vice-versa depending on how lucky they are. Which battle would you like to watch?
A faction tournament...
This is a tournament between factions, each side out to prove they're better than the other. Their lesser conflicts and differences of opinion also get resolved here, resulting in fewer casualties all round.\nThe rules are simple - there are several teams, and they fight each other until just one is left.\nShall we start?
A ravenous pack of Pseudodogs...
A small herd of wild boars...
A whole cageful of Tushkanos...
A shitload of stinking snorks...
An alpha male Bloodsucker...
A Controller, with a horde of zombie acolytes...
A Chimera - but he's not eaten for a week...
One really pissed off Burer...
One tough mofo of a Pseudogiant...
A one on one match...
One of you against two of them...
You against three. A foursome...
You against six. A slaughterhouse...
The Arena's now closed for cleaning and maintenance. No more matches today...
All matches are over. Whoever didn't make it on time - too bad...
And the Arena opens once more! Who wants to be the first blood donor?
Anyone wanting to participate in an Arena match, come to the Bar area immediately. First match begins in three hours...
Six hours until the Arena opens...
Twelve hours until the Arena opens...
A reminder to everyone - Arena matches will resume in exactly 24 hours...
The Arena will open again in 48 hours. Registration for participants in all matches is now open...
The Arena will be open again in three days' time...
Barman
Arena manager
Hey, some shithead's killed Arnie! If you find him, then shoot him - slowly! You'll be well rewarded. The Arena's now closed until we can replace him, so pay attention to the announcements...
We're pleased to announce that we have a new Arena manager. The Arena is open again!
What the hell is this? Some dumbass killed the Arena manager again! There's a reward for anyone who finds this son of a bitch...
Listen here, you bastard! If I find out what your name is, you'd be better off hiding in a Bloodsucker nest! Don't wait until my guys find you, because they'll drag you back here by your guts...
All Stalkers! The Arena manager has been killed. Find the bastard who did it! It's time we stopped this shit once and for all!
Someone's killed Arnie! Find the bastard, kneecap him, and stake him next to a Burner. Anyone who wants to pay their respects can throw a bolt in. Then Duty'll hang him up outside the main gate...
Arnie got drunk and picked a fight with an anomaly. He's now one with the Zone. Sorry, but no more fights in the Arena until we find a new manager. I'll let you all know...
Shit, the new Arena manager's gone walkabout. If anyone can track the smell of alcohol, bring him back and you'll get paid. The Arena stays closed until we find him, or a replacement...
Hey, I just went to the Bar for some vodka. Stay out of here until I'm back!
Hey, losers, I just pissed away all your money at the Bar!
If anyone needs me, I'll be at the Bar. But tell them they won't get any tips from me unless they bring vodka...
Man, day after day it's the same. Vodka, vodka, and more vodka. Fuck that, I'm off to the Bar...
